servinfo.title: DTC P0463: Fuel Level Sensor Circuit High

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0462: Fuel Level Sensor Circuit Low:For Petrol Engine Model .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Fuel level sensor voltage is higher than 4.9 V for 3 seconds continuously.
(1 driving cycle detection logic but MIL does not light up)

item.ptxt: ECM power and/or ground circuit malfunction
Fuel level sensor and/or its circuit malfunction

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Start engine and run it for 30 sec. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting:For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.question: Does fuel level meter in combination meter indicate “E” (empty)?

action.ptxt: Replenish fuel tank with fuel and go to Step 3.

testgroup.question: Do you have SUZUKI scan tool?

testgroup.title: Fuel level sensor output signal check with SUZUKI scan tool

test1.ptxt: Connect SUZUKI scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch and check fuel level displayed on SUZUKI scan tool.

testgroup.question: Is it 3% or less?

action.ptxt: Intermittent trouble. Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: Fuel level sensor output signal check

test1.ptxt: Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Turn ON ignition switch and measure voltage between “E23-24” terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is voltage about 3.5 V or more?

action.ptxt: Intermittent trouble. Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: Fuel level sensor circuit resistance check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to “E23-24” terminal of ECM connector.
If OK, measure resistance between “E23-24” terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is resistance below 280 Ω?

testgroup.title: Short circuit check for fuel level sensor output signal circuit

test1.ptxt: Turn ON ignition switch and measure voltage between “E23-24” terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 0 V?

testgroup.title: Open circuit check for fuel level sensor output signal circuit

test1.ptxt: Disconnect fuel pump connector referring to Fuel Tank Removal and Installation:For Petrol Engine Model .
Check for proper connection to “YEL/RED ” and “YEL/GRN” wire terminals of fuel pump connector.
Turn ON ignition switch, measure voltage between “YEL/RED” wire terminal of disconnected fuel pump connector and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 10 – 14 V?

testgroup.title: Open circuit check for fuel level sensor output signal circuit

test1.ptxt: Measure voltage between “E23-24” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 10 – 14 V?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

testgroup.title: Fuel level sensor ground circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from sub fuel lever sensor with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “BLK/YEL” wire terminal of fuel pump connector and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is resistance below 5 Ω?

action.ptxt: “BLK/YEL” wire in open or high resistance circuit.

testgroup.title: High resistance circuit check for fuel level sensor circuit

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “YEL/RED” wire terminal of fuel pump connector and “E23-24” wire terminal of ECM connector.

testgroup.question: Is resistance below 5 Ω?

test1.ptxt: Check fuel level sensor (main and sub) referring to Fuel Level Sensor Inspection .

action.ptxt: “YEL/GRN” wire between main fuel lever sensor and sub fuel lever sensor is open or high resistance. If wire is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
